title: JK Rowling donates £70,000 to Scottish feminist campaigners to help their Supreme Court appeal against the definition of 'woman'
description: Harry Potter author JK Rowling has donated £70,000 to a feminist campaign to help their Supreme Court appeal against the definition of a woman.

title: My top five tastiest spots ... in and around Stirling
description: I’VE lived around the Stirling area for a long time and have fond memories of many local food and drink firsts.

title: Yousaf urged to house more asylum seekers by Home Office
description: He also cited speeches by other SNP politicians, including Alison Thewliss MP- who said recently that Scotland “will take our responsibilities seriously” while criticising the UK Government. The letter said: “The Home Office has made a commitment to ...

title: Labour seeking SNP deal to avoid new Gaza ceasefire rebellion
description: Party hopes for compromise wording after previous SNP motion saw 56 MPs defy Keir Starmer Labour is hoping to defuse a fresh crisis over Keir Starmer’s cautious stance on Gaza by rewording a Scottish National party motion calling for an immediate ceasefire.

title: Home Office ‘turning blind eye’ to exploitation in Scottish farms
description: And the Home Office has been accused of “turning a blind eye” to the issue by the SNP for not releasing or compiling Scotland-specific data – from how many workers on the visa are in Scotland to where they work – which the party called “unacceptable”.

title: Changing stance? Starmer calls for 'ceasefire that lasts' in Gaza as he rallies Scottish voters

title: Tories think they've spotted a Labour weakness - and are scouring for opportunities
description: The Conservative campaign is seeking Labour candidates' comments about Israel and Gaza following the suspension of two MP-hopefuls last week after their comments about the Middle East.

title: Lack of council tax reform slammed by Labour MSP Katy Clark
description: THE Scottish Government has now passed Stage 1 of its budget for the next year. Incredibly, ministers have had the gall to describe it

title: Ian Blackford’s ‘stolen’ lover used to call him a ‘weeble’, distraught husband claims
description: Ian Blackford’s lover used to say he looked like a weeble, her estranged husband has revealed. Eric Boyle accused the former SNP Westminster leader of “stealing” his wife Kim Lyons and said he was unfit to be a politician.

title: War or peace: decison-time for Starmer
description: DECISION-TIME looms for Sir Keir Starmer as Scottish Labour united at the weekend to call for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza.

title: JK Rowling donates £70k to challenge ruling that men can become women
description: JK Rowling has donated £70,000 to a feminist group to help their bid to obtain a “historic” Supreme Court ruling stating that men cannot become women.

title: Sir Keir Starmer calls for a ceasefire in Gaza
description: Sir Keir Starmer has called for a ‘ceasefire that lasts’ in Gaza during a speech to the Scottish Labour conference.

title: Where do the UK's political parties stand on a Gaza ceasefire?
description: With Labour changing its stance and backing an immediate ceasefire, here's where the main UK parties stand on the Gaza conflict.

title: Keir Starmer Says Fighting In Gaza 'Must Stop Now' And Rafah Offensive 'Cannot Happen'
description: It comes ahead of a Commons vote on Wednesday tabled by the SNP which will ask MPs to back an immediate ceasefire. Starmer suffered a significant rebellion in November when 56 Labour MPs defied his instructions not to support a similar motion. The Labour ...

title: Sarwar calls on Labour to ‘build on’ future UK general election victory
description: Scottish Labour leader Anas Sarwar said a win for Labour in the UK general election could help the party return to power at Holyrood.

title: SNP's plans to ban 'conversion therapy' are 'fundamentally illiberal', says senior lawyer
description: A senior lawyer has warned of state overreach if the SNP's proposed ban on "conversion practices" in Scotland gets the go-ahead.

title: Tories could still win next election, Starmer warns in Glasgow speech
description: Keir Starmer has warned the Tories could still win the next UK general election – despite the party consistently polling around 20 points ahead of their rivals. Speaking to Scottish Labour members on the last day of the party’s conference in Glasgow, the Labour leader took aim at the SNP for claiming Labour is almost certain to win the next ballot.

title: Sir Keir Starmer calls for a 'ceasefire that lasts' in Gaza as he rallies Scottish voters

title: Labour does not rule out supporting motion on Gaza ceasefire
description: Starmer stressed that “any ceasefire cannot be one-sided” and must “lead to a genuine peace process”, as he warned that the threatened offensive in the border town of Rafah, where around half of Gaza’s displaced population has been sheltering, “cannot happen”.

title: Tories can still win 2024 general election, warns Keir Starmer
description: Sir Keir Starmer has said the Tories can still win the next general election, as he warned that "Tory stagnation is a threat to Britain itself"

title: Keir Starmer calls for ‘permanent’ Gaza ceasefire in speech at Scottish Labour conference
description: Labour leader Keir Starmer delivered a speech at the Scottish Labour Conference in Glasgow today (18 February), where he took the opportunity to call for a ceasefire in Gaza. MPs will vote on a second SNP-led motion on an immediate ceasefire in Gaza this week.

title: Starmer calls for a Gaza ‘ceasefire that lasts’ and ‘must happen now’
description: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer has called for a “ceasefire that lasts” in Gaza, insisting that it “must happen now”. In Glasgow for Scottish Labour’s conference, the party leader has come under fresh pressure over his stance on the crisis after members north of the border backed immediate calls for a ceasefire.

title: Labour faces fresh divisions over Gaza as SNP bring new ceasefire vote
description: Labour faces fresh divisions over the Israel-Gaza conflict as a second vote on calling for a ceasefire is set to take place this week.

title: Sir Keir Starmer says North Sea oil and gas will continue ‘for decades to come’ during Scottish Labour Party speech
description: Sir Keir Starmer has insisted work in the North Sea oil and gas sector will continue “for decades to come” as his party continues to face criticism from the industry. It came as the UK Labour leader made a direct appeal to Scots who “have found a new political home with the SNP” to return to his party.

title: Keir Starmer needs to offer Scottish voters positive action for power
description: Sir Keir Starmer’s message was clear – change is needed and only his party can deliver it. But the UK Labour leader will need to offer Scottish voters something positive to cling onto ahead of polling day if his party’s former red heartland is to help him grab hold of the keys to Downing Street.

title: SNP 'inaction' blamed by Labour for rising number of violent incidents in Scottish schools
description: Speaking at Scottish Labour conference, Duncan-Glancy said: "The SNP’s distraction and inaction has led to our classrooms becoming more like pressure cookers, on the edge of boiling point than the nurturing and safe learning environments that they should be.
